title: Embedding Divergence vs LLM-as-Judge: Comparative Analysis
hypothesis: LLM-as-Judge captures philosophical nuances that embedding cosine similarity misses

comparison.title: Leben selbst ist Wille zur Macht
llm_judge_issues: Article insertion: 'will to power' vs 'THE will to power'
comparison.agreement: AGREE - Both methods detect high divergence
comparison.interpretation: Embeddings likely caught lexical variation in the surrounding text, not just the key philosophical term. The phrase 'will to power' itself is consistent across translators.

comparison.title: Pathos der Distanz
llm_judge_issues: Faber's 'grand feeling of distance' loses Greek 'pathos'
comparison.agreement: DISAGREE - LLM finds significant divergence, embeddings miss it
comparison.interpretation: Embeddings cluster 'pathos of distance' and 'grand feeling of distance' closely due to semantic overlap. But philosophical register (Greek-derived vs colloquial) is invisible to embeddings.

comparison.title: Life as Exploitation
llm_judge_issues: Ontological claim (life IS exploitation) vs activity (life does exploitation)
comparison.agreement: DISAGREE - LLM finds significant divergence, embeddings miss it
comparison.interpretation: Gerunds and nouns from same root have nearly identical embeddings. The grammatical difference carrying philosophical weight is invisible to vector similarity.

comparison.title: Herren-Moral und Sklaven-Moral
comparison.agreement: PARTIAL AGREE - Both detect elevated divergence
comparison.interpretation: Longer passage with more lexical variation. Embeddings likely caught surface-level differences. LLM additionally caught grammatical-philosophical issues (singular/plural ideal types).

comparison.title: Was ist vornehm?
llm_judge_issues: 'Rule of the plebs' vs 'mob rule' vs 'incipient mob rule'
comparison.agreement: DISAGREE - LLM finds significant divergence, embeddings miss it
comparison.interpretation: 'Reverence' (noun) and 'reveres' (verb) have virtually identical embeddings. But the ontological difference (state of being vs activity) is philosophically significant.

embeddings_miss: Grammatical structure (noun vs verb, singular vs plural)
Article insertion changing identity claims to attributions
Subtle ontological distinctions encoded in syntax
summary.agreement_rate: 2/5 (40%) - embeddings and LLM-as-Judge agree on divergence level
summary.key_insight: Embedding divergence is a 'precise calculation of a vague proxy' (Pieter Maes). High embedding similarity does NOT mean philosophical equivalence.
